item.title: False Normality
item.description: pre { max-height: 300px; overflow-y: auto; } pre[class] { max-height: 300px; } A lot of statistical tests assume normal distribution of raw data or residuals from predicted model outcomes. One way to check for normality is visual, using histograms or Q-Q plots. Another way is statistical. Of the statistical tests of normality, the Shapiro-Wilk test is the most powerful. See Razali and Wah for further discussion about power.
